title: 2.3 Billion People Still Lack Safe Sanitation
description: A quick, practical guide to 2.3 Billion People Still Lack Safe Sanitation.

hook.text: One in three humans has no access to a safe toilet. Globally, 494 million people still defecate in the open.

buildup.text: Poor sanitation kills 800,000 yearlyâ€”mostly children under five. It's the second-leading killer of kids worldwide.

discovery.text: The Gates Foundation funded a toilet needing no water, sewer, or electricity. It runs on solar-powered chemistry.

twist.text: The problem isn't techâ€”it's cost. Sewering every village costs trillions. Solutions must be dirt cheap to scale.

climax.text: The UN targets universal sanitation by 2030. At the current pace, the world will miss the deadline by decades.

punchline.text: The toilet is a privilege half the world is still waiting for.

quiz.question: What is the main barrier to providing safe sanitation globally?
options: The enormous cost of building sewer infrastructure in every community
Lack of scientific knowledge about waste treatment
Cultural resistance to using modern toilets
